function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Use of sensor nodes to measure gaseous pollutants may lead to potential contamination if not properly maintained.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Integration of smart mobile standards, wsn, and other sensing technologies may introduce cybersecurity risks if not properly secured.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Designing separate battery units for the sensor network introduces the risk of battery failure and data loss if not monitored effectively.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of monitoring for indoor air quality iaq parameters such as humidity, temperature, gaseous pollutants, and pm.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate or delayed estimation of atmospheric changes and pollutants in indoor environments.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper air quality monitoring leading to potential exposure to air contaminants and pollutants.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate indoor air quality assessment leading to potential health risks from indoor pollutants.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Usage of high integrity serial bus protocol can may lead to potential data breaches or security vulnerabilities.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Utilization of low-cost micro gas sensors and arduino microcontroller may result in inaccurate iaq monitoring and data quality issues.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on wireless communication using zigbee module may introduce interference and communication disruptions in iaq monitoring system.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependency on energy-saving performance validation test for system effectiveness","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor indoor air quality iaq due to the presence of gases co2, vocs, so2, nox, co, pm, and ozone in different indoor settings.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High power consumption of gas sensors used for iaq monitoring.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliability and calibration issues with environmental settings and sensor characteristics for accurate iaq monitoring.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of diseases due to contaminated air","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased health issues due to indoor air pollution","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of indoor air quality parameters","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate monitoring of iaq parameters","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher concentration of vocs in buildings can lead to skin, throat, and respiratory irritation, as well as a broader set of illnesses including headaches, fatigue, and respiratory symptoms.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mixture of pollutants in indoor air can generate secondary pollutants that are more harmful than the primary ones.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of biological agents in indoor air can degrade overall air quality and cause respiratory diseases and allergic sensitization.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of hazardous chemical pollutants such as vocs, co, and so2 in indoor environments","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ground-level ozone as a cause of respiratory health diseases","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Health risks associated with high co2 concentration in indoor air","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Routine exposure to non-liquid petroleum gas fuel linked to acute infections in the lower respiratory tract, including pneumonia and severe pneumonia.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentration of pollutants such as particle matter in urban indoor environments, with a large proportion of ultra-fine particles.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Excessive exposure to solid fuel increasing the number of deaths among children in the age group of 1 to 4","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Solid fuel reported as the most significant reason behind many cases of non-fatal pneumonia","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced circulation of fresh air in buildings","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased presence of vocs in indoor environments","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Factors affecting indoor environment including air exchange, humidity, temperature, ventilation, pollutants","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to reduced indoor air quality, causing health issues.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Excessive concentration of total suspended particles in poorly ventilated kitchens.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation leading to loss of productivity","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High temperatures due to lack of ventilation leading to loss of productivity","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation systems in refurbishment alternatives leading to poor indoor air quality and high indoor temperatures.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation rates may lead to increased prevalence of respiratory diseases.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High indoor temperatures causing a decrement in productivity","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low ventilation rates leading to higher prevalence of respiratory diseases","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate control of temperature leading to excessively high indoor temperatures","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dismantling of partition walls may disrupt the containment of contagious diseases and facilitate their spread within the building.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Refurbishment plans and changes in indoor climate may impact ventilation and air quality, potentially affecting disease transmission rates within the building.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Outdated hvac system with no cooling","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Fixed utility rooms between corridors","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Poor indoor climate leading to health issues","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adequate ventilation and cooling due to increased space efficiency","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative consequences of greater efficiency on indoor climate","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disproportionate impact on low-skilled workers, women, youths, and marginalized individuals","category":"Social","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uneven impact of robots on workers with different skill levels","category":"Social","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Skill-biased technological changes","category":"Social","confidence":"High"}]}
